change.changenote: Section 2 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 374/2010, effective December 17, 2010.

section.sectiontext: This regulation shall be used for determinations of value for the purposes of assessment for the 2008 and subsequent taxation years.

change.changenote: Section 3 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 374/2010, effective December 17, 2010.

section.sectiontext: The actual value of the pole lines, cables, towers, poles and wires of a telephone corporation shall be determined using the rate of $386 per access line.

change.changenote: Section 3 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 223/2011, effective December 5, 2011.

section.sectiontext: The actual value of the pole lines, cables, towers, poles and wires of a telephone corporation shall be determined using the rate of $410 per access line.

section.sectiontext: The actual value of the pole lines, cables, towers, poles and wires of a telephone corporation shall be determined using the rate of $422 per access line.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The actual value of the pole lines, cables, towers, poles and wires of a telephone corporation must be determined using the rate of $483 per access line.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The actual value of the pole lines, cables, towers, poles and wires of a telephone corporation must be determined using the rate of $493 per access line.

change.changenote: Section 3 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 284/2019, effective December 18, 2019.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The actual value of the pole lines, cables, towers, poles and wires of a telephone corporation must be determined using the rate of $501 per access line.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The actual value of the pole lines, cables, towers, poles and wires of a telephone corporation must be determined using the rate of $511 per access line.

change.changenote: Section 3 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 315/2021, effective December 1, 2021.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The actual value of the pole lines, cables, towers, poles and wires of a telephone corporation must be determined using the rate of $529 per access line.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The actual value of the pole lines, cables, towers, poles and wires of a telephone corporation must be determined using the rate of $549 per access line.

change.changenote: Section 3.1 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 374/2010, effective December 17, 2010.

section.sectiontext: Despite section 2, the actual value of the pole lines, cables, towers, poles and wires of a telephone corporation shall, for the 2006 taxation year, be determined using the rate of $371 per access line.

change.changenote: Section 4 (2), tables 1 and 3 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 374/2010, effective December 17, 2010.

subsection.subsectiontext: The actual value of a fibre optics cable, unless section 9 applies, is determined using the rates set out in Tables 1 to 4.

change.changenote: Section 4 (2), Tables 1 and 3 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 223/2011, effective December 5, 2011.

Section 7 (1) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 315/2016, effective December 19, 2016.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Where, in respect of a telecommunications cable referred to in section 21 (1) (a) of the Assessment Act,

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: a senior executive of the corporation provides the assessment authority with documentation certifying that the cable has been properly abandoned, and
the telecommunications cable would, if valued under section 19 of the Assessment Act, and in that reference to section 21 of the Assessment Act, have no value,

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: the actual value of the telecommunications cable shall be determined using a rate of $1.

change.changenote: Section 8 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 315/2016, effective December 19, 2016.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Where a fibre optics cable, of a telecommunications corporation referred to in section 21 (1) (a) of the Assessment Act, is under construction, the assessor shall determine the percentage complete as of October 31 and the actual value of the line shall be determined by applying the percentage complete to the rate prescribed for that class.

change.changenote: Section 9 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 374/2010, effective December 17, 2010.

section.sectiontext: The actual value of the lines, cables and wires, including fibre optics cable, of a cable television corporation is determined using the rate of $195 per subscriber drop.

change.changenote: Section 9 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 223/2011, effective December 5, 2011.

section.sectiontext: The actual value of the lines, cables and wires, including fibre optics cable, of a cable television corporation is determined using the rate of $203 per subscriber drop.

change.changenote: Section 9 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 391/2012, effective December 7, 2012.

section.sectiontext: The actual value of the lines, cables and wires, including fibre optics cable, of a cable television corporation is determined using the rate of $211 per subscriber drop.

change.changenote: Section 9 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 231/2014, effective December 10, 2014.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The actual value of the lines, cables and wires, including fibre optics cable, of a cable television corporation is determined using the rate of $218 per subscriber drop.

change.changenote: Section 9 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 262/2015, effective December 23, 2015.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The actual value of the lines, cables and wires, including fibre optics cable, of a cable television corporation is determined using the rate of $260 per subscriber drop.

change.changenote: Section 9 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 315/2016, effective December 19, 2016.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The actual value of the lines, cables and wires, including fibre optics cable, of a cable television corporation is determined using the rate of $310 per subscriber drop.

change.changenote: Section 9 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 246/2017, effective December 20, 2017.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The actual value of the lines, cables and wires, including fibre optics cable, of a cable television corporation is determined using the rate of $371 per subscriber drop.

change.changenote: Section 9 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 284/2018, effective December 14, 2018.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The actual value of the lines, cables and wires, including fibre optics cable, of a cable television corporation is determined using the rate of $376 per subscriber drop.

change.changenote: Section 9 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 284/2019, effective December 18, 2019.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The actual value of the lines, cables and wires, including fibre optics cable, of a cable television corporation is determined using the rate of $382 per subscriber drop.

change.changenote: Section 9 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 300/2020, effective December 21, 2020.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The actual value of the lines, cables and wires, including fibre optics cable, of a cable television corporation is determined using the rate of $390 per subscriber drop.

change.changenote: Section 9 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 315/2021, effective December 1, 2021.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The actual value of the lines, cables and wires, including fibre optics cable, of a cable television corporation is determined using the rate of $407 per subscriber drop.

change.changenote: Section 9 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 261/2022, effective December 1, 2022.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The actual value of the lines, cables and wires, including fibre optics cable, of a cable television corporation is determined using the rate of $406 per subscriber drop.

change.changenote: Section 10 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 374/2010, effective December 17, 2010.

section.sectiontext: The actual value of a tower is determined using the rates set out in Appendix A and, the assessment commissioner being of the opinion that the rates for valuing improvements under Appendix A of this regulation have changed substantially for the 2006 tax year from the rates for the 2005 tax year, the rates that would have been in effect for the 2006 tax year will be phased in equally over 3 years.

change.changenote: Section 11.1 was enacted by BC Reg 231/2014, effective December 10, 2014.
Section 11.1 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 246/2017, effective December 20, 2017.

bcl:section.bcl:text: Pursuant to section 21 (4.1) of the Assessment Act, the assessment authority, being of the opinion that the rates for valuing improvements under sections 4 (2) and 9 of the regulation have changed substantially for the 2015 taxation year from the rates for the 2014 taxation year, the rate that would have been in effect for the 2015 taxation year will be phased in equally over 3 years.

change.changenote: Section 11.1 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 300/2020, effective December 21, 2020.

bcl:section.bcl:text: For the purposes of section 21 (4.1) of the Assessment Act, the rates referred to in section 10 of this regulation, that would be used to determine the actual value of a tower for the 2018 taxation year, are to be phased in equally over 3 years.

change.changenote: Appendix A BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 374/2010, effective December 17, 2010.

tablecol.strong: Communication towers — Installed Rates per Foot

tablerow.tablecol: Tower Rates Include: Foundations, Supply, Freight, Erection, Paint, Warning Lights, Lightning Rods, Cabling, Connection Devices, Contractor's Mark-up, P.S.T. and Owner's Costs.
Tower Rates Exclude: Antennas, Dishes, Reflectors, Radar, Radomes, Communication Buildings, Interconnecting Cable Tray and Cable Bridges.

Low Cost Guyed Towers
(Non-CSA)
Height in Feet

schedule.centertext: Note: For stepped towers, the rate per foot for each section will be based on the total overall height of the tower.

tablerow.tablecol:
Low Cost Self Supported Towers (Non-CSA)
Height in Feet

Self Supported Towers
(CSA)
Height in Feet
Communication towers — Installed Rates per Foot
Tower Rates Include: Foundations, Supply, Freight, Erection, Paint, Warning Lights, Lightning Rods, Cabling, Connection Devices, Contractor's Mark-up, P.S.T. and Owner's Costs.
Tower Rates Exclude: Antennas, Dishes, Reflectors, Radar, Radomes, Communication Buildings, Interconnecting Cable Tray and Cable Bridges.
Each additional platform for monopoles (regardless of tower height)

tablecol.strong: SUPPORT STRUCTURES AND CUSTOM TOWERS for Radomes, Heavily Loaded Microwave Facilities and Passive Repeaters, etc.

tablerow.tablecol:
Rate per cubic foot based on the volume enclosed within the exterior members of each frame.
For passive repeaters, do not measure framing in the reflector or between reflector and support structure.
